Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2014 05:58AM TJG2 wrote: What I could tolerate changed each treatment. Cheese was the one thing that I could stand throughout. Dark chocolate Ensure was a staple. Even if most things taste awful, keeping up strength is important and Ensure helped with that. Gaterade also helped keep me hydrated and gave me a boost of energy. If you get to a point that one of your drugs causes mouth irritation, your oncologist can prescribe a rinse that will allow you to eat. It cost me $9 but it was worth it, I used it two days out of the entire 6 rounds of chemo. Good luck everyone!
Posts.Title: What to eat when everything tases terrible, awful? Sjacobs146 rozem
